front.title: SOCKS64: An IPv4-IPv6 intercommunication gateway using SOCKS5 protocol

abstract.t: This memo describes an IPv4-IPv6 intercommunication method based on the SOCKS5 protocol. The method is called SOCKS64, and was first announced in the 40th IETF meeting at Washington DC in December 1997 as one of three translators being developed in the WIDE Project. SOCKS64 is a gateway system that accepts SOCKS5 connections from IPv4 hosts and relays it to IPv4/IPv6 hosts using proper protocols. We have designed and implemented a prototype SOCKS64 system and have been testing the prototype in many environments. Also we are distributing the prototype as a KAME distribution package. This article describes the SOCKS64; its principle, implementation, experimental results and comparison to other IPv4-IPv6 intercommunication methods.
